Description: Reconstructed rim sherd (mended from four fragments with added plaster) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; possible traces of bands in faded added colour; exterior: at rim, maeander band running left; below, on left, squares with maeanders between dividing bands of vertical maeander; to right, corner pendant decoration with part of dotted circle below; on right, painted decoration consisting of hindquarters of goat (dotted underbelly, rump and tail remaining), to right; above, part of pendant triangle as filling ornament; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.473.m and 1888,0601.478.l and belongs to the same vase as 1924,1201.309.a and 1924,1201.309.b. Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices as the sherd displays patterns similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43, note 96, p. 72, p. 235, no. 147, pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0179) (phase 2)
